t: Job 36
Elihu*p also proceeded, and said,
Suffer*p me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.
I*p will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
For*p truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
Behold,*p God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
He*p preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.
He*p withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
And*p if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;
Then*p he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
He*p openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
If*p they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
But*p if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
But*p the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.
They*p die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
He*p delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
Even*p so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
But*p thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.
Because*p there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
Will*p he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
Desire*p not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
Take*p heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
Behold,*p God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?
Who*p hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
Remember*p that thou magnify his work, which men behold.
Every*p man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
Behold,*p God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
For*p he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
Which*p the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
Also*p can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
Behold,*p he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
For*p by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.
With*p clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
The*p noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
